content.name: channels_data_createElement
content.text: Accessor to create an element in the opened model

syntax.doc: an xml resource with the initial state of the element

section.name: purpose
section.content:
The channels_data_createElement accessor puts a new element in the currently opened model. But first it initializes it with a unique id and the uri of the schema by which it is validated. Then it validates the new element against its schema before putting it into the DBXML container of the model.
If successful the response is the new element as stored, otherwise an exception is thrown.
Initialization
An initialized element will have an id element and a schema attribute in the root element.
The name tag is required and will be used to identify the document in the container. The container tag specifies the identity of the container in the BDXML database into which the document is put.
Validation The kind argument is used to locate the appropriate RelaxNG schema against which to validate the fully initialized element prior to storing it. If the validation fails, an exception is raised. The schemas are located under /resources/schemas and must be in RelaxNG's XML format.
